reason: Forward reference to non-existent proof: The statement claims this is 'proved in Section 2, Lemma 2.3', but the current proof tree (see 'af status') shows we are in Section 1 and there is no Section 2 anywhere in the tree. This creates a circular dependency problem: we cannot use Lemma 2.3 to justify the Archimedean condition being weaker if Lemma 2.3 itself might depend on the Archimedean condition. Either (a) Lemma 2.3 must be proven BEFORE this node, or (b) this node must be moved to AFTER Section 2, or (c) a self-contained argument must be given here without forward reference.
